Now that we have a deal, let’s get to work on a permanent solution to fund the government and secure our border.

Today, I grabbed coffee with a local mother whose daughter serves in the Coast Guard. Her story is like many others throughout the country right now. We must do our jobs, find common ground, and end this shutdown. pic.twitter.com/ORmrax7NRp
Hitting the road this morning for a busy day in #WI01...I knew it was cold...I didn’t think it was THAT cold! pic.twitter.com/z6B7vqAzTg

A couple of things...

1- Today’s vote in the House was more political theater, not a solution to end the shutdown
2- We should be in D.C. tomorrow and every day until we reopen the government

Let’s do our jobs, stay in D.C., and end this shutdown!

The Coast Guard's commitment to serving our country is admirable. Many are reporting to duty, without pay, to protect our nation. The shutdown should've ended 34 days ago, but if it lasts a day longer, we must pass this bill today so @USCG can receive pay. https://steil.house.gov/media/press-releases/steil-cosponsors-bill-pay-members-coast-guard-during-shutdown …

Today, President Trump offered a path to end the shutdown. Now it is time for Senate Democrats and Nancy Pelosi to display a similar willingness to compromise and finally bring an end to this impasse. I'm hopeful that with the president’s offer, real progress is finally possible.

In the private sector, you never stop working until the job is done. Why isn’t this true in Washington? Disappointed that Speaker Pelosi adjourned the House for the weekend in the midst of a government shutdown. We need to solve this now!
